agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: The steps differ depending on whether you want to apply for a California Instruction Permit or a California Motorcycle Instruction Permit. If you tell me which type of permit you are interested in, I can provide more information.

AB 60 Driver’s Licenses

Knowledge and Drive Tests Preparation

The first milestone on the road to getting your California driver’s license (DL) is to obtain your provisional instruction permit, sometimes called a “learner’s permit.” This is for people who are learning to drive and working on the requirements to get a DL.

Visit the California Driver’s Handbook to get all the knowledge you need to start!

info-icon

	Notification icon	

Help improve the way California drivers get a license. Download the new mobile DMV TestBuddy App!

	To apply for a California Instruction Permit (under age 18), you must:
	

plus

minus

Be at least 15 ½ but under 18.
Have a Certificate of Completion/Enrollment of Driver Education.
Complete the California Driver’s License or ID Card Application.
Have a parent(s)/guardian(s) sign the application.
Visit a DMV office (schedule an appointment), where you will:

Bring your California Identification Card or proof of identity and residency. (Federal Noncompliant/REAL ID/AB60)
Pay the application fee.
Pass a vision exam.
Take a photo.
Take the knowledge test(s). There are multiple choice questions based on the California Driver’s Handbook, and a passing score is 80%.

Please refer to Provisional Licensing for additional information.

	To apply for a California Instruction Permit (over age 18), you must:
	

plus

minus

ml.tokens.model_text:
|user|: How old do I have to be to drive in CA?
|assistant|: To get a provisional instruction permit (which is for people who are learning to drive and working on the requirements to get a driver's license) you must be at least 15 ½ years old. However, I do not have information on the minimum age requirements for a driver's license in California.
|user|: Are you sure? I am pretty sure you can get a permit as soon as you are 15 years old.
|assistant|: Based on my information, the minimum age to get a provisional instruction permit in California is 15 ½ years.
|user|: How do I apply?

contexts.text:
Instruction and Learner's Permits - California DMV
(Federal Noncompliant/REAL ID/AB60)
Pay the application fee.
Pass a vision exam.
Take a photo.
Take the knowledge test(s). There are multiple choice questions based on the California Driver’s Handbook, and a passing score is 80%.

Please refer to Provisional Licensing for additional information.

	To apply for a California Instruction Permit (over age 18), you must:
	

plus

minus

Be at least 18.
Complete the California Driver’s License or ID Card Application.
Visit a DMV office (schedule an appointment), where you will:

Bring your California Identification Card or proof of identity and residency. (Federal Noncompliant/REAL ID/AB60)
Pay the application fee.
Pass a vision exam.
Take a photo.
Take the knowledge test(s). There are multiple choice questions based on the California Driver’s Handbook, and a passing score is 80%.

Please refer to Driver’s Licenses for additional information.

	To apply for a California Motorcycle Instruction Permit, you must:
	

plus

minus

Be at least 15 ½.
Have a Certificate of Completion of Driver Education and Driver Training if you are between the ages of 15 ½ and 17 ½.
Complete a California Highway Patrol approved California Motorcyclist Safety Program (CMSP) motorcyclist training course, and receive a Certificate of Completion of Motorcycle Training (DL 389) if you are between the ages of 15 ½ to 21.
Complete the California Driver’s License or ID Card Application.
Have a parent(s)/guardian(s) sign the application if you are under 18.
Visit a DMV office (schedule an appointment), where you will:

Bring your California Identification Card or proof of identity and residency. (Federal Noncompliant/REAL ID/AB60)
Pay the application fee.
Pass a vision exam.
Take a photo.
Take the knowledge test(s). There are multiple choice questions based on the California Motorcycle Handbook, and a passing score is 80%.

Please refer to Motorcycle Licenses for additional information.

|user|: How old do I have to be to drive in CA?
|assistant|: To get a provisional instruction permit (which is for people who are learning to drive and working on the requirements to get a driver's license) you must be at least 15 ½ years old. However, I do not have information on the minimum age requirements for a driver's license in California.
|user|: Are you sure? I am pretty sure you can get a permit as soon as you are 15 years old.
|assistant|: Based on my information, the minimum age to get a provisional instruction permit in California is 15 ½ years.
|user|: How do I apply?

agent.original_text:
To apply for a California Instruction Permit, you must be at least 15 ½ years old (under 18) or 18 years old (for adults). Here are the steps to follow:
For applicants under 18 years old:
1. Obtain a Certificate of Completion/Enrollment of Driver Education.
2. Complete the California Driver’s License or ID Card Application.
3. Have a parent(s)/guardian(s) sign the application.
4. Visit a DMV office (schedule an appointment), bringing your California Identification Card or proof of identity and residency, paying the application fee, passing a vision exam, taking a photo, and taking the knowledge test(s).
For applicants 18 years old or older:
1. Complete the California Driver’s License or ID Card Application.
2. Visit a DMV office (schedule an appointment), bringing your California Identification Card or proof of identity and residency, paying the application fee, passing a vision exam, taking a photo, and taking the knowledge test(s).
For a California Motorcycle Instruction Permit, the steps are similar, but you must also have a Certificate of Completion of Driver Education and Driver Training (if you are between 15 ½ and 17 ½) or complete a California Highway Patrol approved California Motorcyclist Safety Program (CMSP) motorcyclist training course (if you are between 15 ½ and 21).

llm_based_tags.reasoning: The query 'How do I apply?' is incomplete - it lacks the object of application (apply for what? a job, a program, a visa, a loan?). This is a classic incomplete fragment with implicit reference to something that must have been discussed in prior conversation.
